[h1]My Thoughts on Half Life 2[/h1]

[h1]The Port[/h1]

This game is a pretty solid port. It rarely ever, if it even does, crash, the options menu is fantastic, besides some weird UI designs, with varied graphics options, including a slightly limited FOV slider, proper AA and other basic graphics options, the control options are awesome with a wide range of fully rebindable keys, as well as a controller option but I'm not sure if those are rebindable, or even changeable at all, as well as pretty good audio options and even an option for enabling VR. Pretty fly port if you ask me.

[h1]The Graphics/Performance[/h1]

The graphics are actually fantastic for this game. Character models are flawless with amazing facial animation, and animation in general, as well as fantastic gun models, pretty great particles, amazing looking water and some awesome lighting effects. The only downside is the geometry isn't the best and some objects are blocky and not very well modelled. Besides that the game looks fantastic. It's honestly really hard to believe this game came out in 2004. The performance in this game is simeply incredible as well. I'm able to run it at 240-300 FPS all the time on an FX 4300 OC's to 4.5GHz(it changes all the time I know I'm still working on finding a stable clock speed) and an EVGA GTX 750 ti. It runs phenominally and looks awesome.

[h1]The Story/Atmosphere/Characters[/h1]

This game's story is really fucking good, and I mean REALLY fucking good. All the characters are very interesting, very well written and extremely well voice acted. The story is just something I can't explain. It's the story of a group of rebels and some scientists trying to bring down the reign of an alien armed force known as the Combine as well as their... I guess leader of which I've forgotten the name of. Also the greatest thing about playing as Gordan Freeman is that you are literally him. He's a silent protaganist which makes it feel like you are him. Every thought, spoken word and action is you and, to me, he is the best god damn protaganist ever. Also, throughout the entire game there are absolutely no cutscenes. Everything is told through gameplay and background details. It's a game you have to really pay attention to as you play to truly understand all the shit that's happening. Not to mention the villain is actually really good. The ending had me a little mixed on how I felt about him but he was generally good not gonna lie. And speaking of the ending holy shit is it quite the ending. Also the atmosphere is kinda hard to explain for this game. It's a very rich atmosphere that contains a lot of different things in it. War, horror, espionage, sci-fi. It's hard to narrow down exactly but holy shit is it a fucking rich ass atmosphere.

[h1]The Controls[/h1]

The controls for this game are awesome. Every control is mapped out very well, the options menu for the mouse is very nice with options for mouse smoothing, acceleration and even god damn raw mouse. It's fantastic and really there's not much else to say.

[h1]The Gameplay[/h1]

The gameplay is really something else. You are 100% involved with everything you do in this game. Every single god damn thing. You kill the enemies, you press the buttons, you jump around, you swing the crowbar, it's all fucking you and it is glorious. The epic action all happens realtime, the firefights, the blowing up of striders, the mass murder of the Combine, everything. It is an epic game with epic action that makes you want more. Although I have some gripes with the game. The gunplay is less than pleasing with the lack of recoil, but somehow very wide bullet spread, of the automatic guns and the very weak and tedious pistol. The grenades are fine, albeit kinda finnicky, the RPG is cool as shit, the revolver is kinda hard to use but still awesome and the shotgun is fucking sweet, but the automatic rifles are not that great. 

The AI in this game is also kinda questionable, although really fucking well made. The Combine AI just kinda sucks. It isn't basic it's actually quite complex with how they try to lure you out of hiding with grenades and how they try to flank you and all that shit. Their pathfinding is actually pretty great too. Your allies AI is awesome though. They actually move out of your fucking way if you're blocking them, are great at fighting, manage to use cover very well, are great at following and don't have any real pathfinding issues, besides sometimes when they won't follow you if you move to quickly, and too far, ahead, but that's forgiveable for the awesome AI that was given to the allies. See how it's done, other game developers? Valve knows how it's done. Also all the missions are just fucking awesome I can not stress that enough. Not to mention the extremely impressive physics engine that I can't believe existed in 2004, let alone 2016. Seriously Valve stop making Dota and shit and make a Half Life 3. Or at the very least finish the Episodes.

[h1]The Conclusion[/h1]

I'm going to be honest I did not like this game at all when I first played it. I just could not get into it. After giving it a second chance I have completely changed my opition on it and God do I absolutely love this game. There are little things such as the weird gunplay, weird Combine AI and cancerous ladders but besides all that it is an amazing game with awesome characters and a fantastic story. Seriously if you haven't picked this masterpiece up you NEED to play it. For God's sake it's $10 on Steam and like half that on G2A. Hell, pick up the episodes if you're already done this game those are even cheaper on both Steam and G2A and I'm sure are just as good. Sadly, there doesn't seem to be any future plans for Half Life Episode 3 or just Half Life 3 in general, since Valve said they're not planning on doing anymore work on these games and are instead working on their other series, such as Portal and Left 4 Dead, as well as eventually finished the Source 2 engine. This game is a pure masterpiece that any FPS fan seriously needs to play. Now stop reading this god damn review and play this shit already. This review does not do this game justice in the slightest as there are way more people who can explain this game much better than I can. Honestly I probably undersold the game if anything. Just... just go play it I don't even know why you're still reading this.

Game Review for Half-Life 2 by ToxicMouse01:

Reminder: Since this is a SinglePlayer Game I am going to do it differently

Intro: Half-Life 2 is a Sequel to the masterpiece Known as Half Life where the Combine have invaded Earth and its up to Gordon Freeman and his gang to save the world.

Voice Acting: The Voice Acting is good ,but sometimes like Dr Kliener his voice acting is a little cheesy ,but it does have good voice acting. I wish Gordon Talked

Graphics: This is One of the first games to use the "Source" Engine and the graphics look great I loved it.

Sound: The sound is good ,but I think it could be better seeing that this is a remake to one of the most Beloved games.

Gameplay: The Gameplay is good ,but it does get too easy luckly there is the Difflculty Choice in Options bar to keep it Hard.

Story: The Lore and Story is Great one of the best I have seen because it is easy to follow and isn't all over the place (Like Cod) and it brings back the old characters like Eli and Barney and Adds some in like Alyx.

Animations: They look good for a shooter game ,but you can't go into third person which is kinda a shame.

Score:
Voice Acting: 8/10
Graphics: 9/10
Sound: 7/10
Gameplay: 10/10
Story: 9.5
Overall: 9.8

Since I've played the whole Half-Life series I am bringing a full review.

Half-Life 2

Story:

The sequel to the science fiction shooter Half-Life (1998)

You take control of the Black Mesa MIT Scientist Gordon Freeman.
After defeat of Nihilanth in Half-Life 1 You've ben put in stasis.
After waking up you're 30 or 20 Years in the future witnessing the Human race has ben the slave of the combine. As you meet up with Barney Calhoun who's a Ex-Guard from Black Mesa Is pointing out the direction the labs, on the way you meet Alyx Vance, A daugther of Eli Vance. After making into the labs Dr. Kleiner Provides you with Your H.E.V suit MK IV After test gone wrong you fight your way to Black Mesa East, Lab controlled By Eli Vance and Dr. Judith Mossman.
Alyx is going to give you the Gravity gub, After being Greeted by DOG The Combine Raid starts, You have to escape from Black Mesa East trough Ravenholm, A Zombie invested town by one Survivor, Father Grigori. You'll fight with him for a while after escaping the mines. After Making contact with Other Citizens You have to go to Nova Prospekt, A prison built by combines.
After Rescuing Eli Vance, Dr. Mossman betrays you and after escaping Nova Prospekt With Alyx 
You two realize you're caught in a slow Teleport.
Now The streets of City 17 is a battle zone of Rebels and Combine Forces. After fighting for some time, Alyx gets captured. Wich means you have to go the Citadel. Then you'll meet Dr. Breen. Once you're set free You and Alyx are going to fight Breen. After destroying the core and the Citadel. The game ends there.

Conclusion:

For my first full playtrough I thought it was an Amazing sequel. For anyone wondering to pick up this game I'd say Buy it with an Amazing storyline.

Rating: 10/10
